required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: A Study of the Cataractogenic Potential of Seroquel and Risperdal in the Treatment of Participants With Schizophrenia or Schizoaffective Disorder
clinical_study.official_title: A Multicenter, Open Label, Flexible-dose, Parallel-group Evaluation of the Cataractogenic Potential of Quetiapine Fumarate (Seroquel) and Risperidone (Risperdal) in the Long Term Treatment of Participants With Schizophrenia or Schizoaffective Disorder

brief_summary.textblock: This Phase IV, randomized, parallel-group study is designed to evaluate the cataractogenic potential of quetiapine fumarate (SEROQUEL) compared with that of a putative non-cataractogenic antipsychotic medication risperidone (RISPERDAL). This study is being conducted to fulfill the SEROQUEL Phase IV commitment regarding evaluation of cataractogenic potential.

primary_outcome.measure: Presence of a Cortical (C) Type of Cataractogenic Potential Events in Participants as Assessed and Agreed by 2 Independent, Treatment-masked Ophthalmologists Using the Lens Opacities Classification System II (LOCS II ) Grading Scale
primary_outcome.description: Presence of C type of cataractogenic potential event in participant was defined if any LOCS II grades of 2, 3, 4, 5 (with any grade of 0, trace,1 at randomization) assessed and agreed by 2 independent, treatment-masked ophthalmologists at any post-randomization assessment in one or both eyes. 0= no cataract; 5 is worst. There are no subscales. 0 is the best, 5 is the worst.

primary_outcome.measure: Presence of a Nuclear Opalescence (N) Type of Cataractogenic Potential Events in Participants as Assessed and Agreed by 2 Independent, Treatment-masked Ophthalmologists Using the LOCS II Grading Scale
primary_outcome.description: Presence of N type of cataractogenic potential event in Participants was defined if any LOCS II grades of 2, 3, 4 (with grade at rand equals 0,1), or if the LOCS II grades of 3,or 4 (with grade at randomization=2) assessed and agreed by 2 independent, treatment-masked ophthalmologists at any post-randomization assessment in one or both eyes. 0 is the best, 4 is the worst.

primary_outcome.measure: Presence of a Posterior Subcapsular (P) Type Cataractogenic Potential Events in Participants as Assessed and Agreed by 2 Independent, Treatment-masked Ophthalmologists Using the LOCS II Grading Scale
primary_outcome.description: Presence of P type of cataractogenic potential event in participant was defined if any LOCS II grades of 1, 2, 3 , 4 (with grade=0 at randomization) assessed and agreed by 2 independent, treatment-masked ophthalmologists at any post-randomization assessment in one or both eyes. 0 is the best, 4 is the worst.

secondary_outcome.measure: Change in the Positive and Negative Syndrome Scale (PANSS) Total Score
secondary_outcome.description: PANSS total score equals sum of the 30-items scores (range: 30-210). Each item has ( 1-7 units), 1 indicates "absent" psychosis symptom, and 7 - "extreme" symptom degree. Change in PANSS total score : total score at month 24 minus total score at randomization.Alleviation of psychotic symptoms are indicated by a negative change in PANSS total score.

secondary_outcome.measure: Change in the PANSS Positive Subscale Score
secondary_outcome.description: PANSS Positive subscale score equals sum of the 7-items scores(range:7-49). Each item has ( 1-7 units), 1 indicates "absent" psychosis symptom, and 7 - "extreme" symptom degree.

secondary_outcome.measure: Change in the PANSS Negative Subscale Score
secondary_outcome.description: PANSS Negative subscale score equals sum of the 7-items scores(range:7-49). Each item has ( 1-7 units), 1 indicates "absent" psychosis symptom, and 7 - "extreme" symptom degree. Change in PANSS Negative subscale score:score at month 24 minus score at randomization. Alleviation of negative psychotic symptoms are indicated by a negative change score.

secondary_outcome.measure: Change in the PANSS Psychopathology Subscale Score
secondary_outcome.description: PANSS psychopathology subscale score equals sum of the 16-items scores(range:16-112). Each item has ( 1-7 units),1= "absent" psychosis symptom, 7= "extreme" symptom degree.Change in PANSS psychopathology subscale:score at month 24 minus score at randomization. Alleviation of general psychopathology symptoms are indicated by a negative change score.

secondary_outcome.measure: Change in the Clinical Global Impression - Severity of Illness (CGI-S) Score
secondary_outcome.description: CGI-S score is accessed on a seven-graded scale ranging from most extremely ill/ very much worse (7) to normal/very much improved (1) , 1 is best. Change : score at month 24 minus score at randomization.

secondary_outcome.measure: Change in Health-related Quality of Life as Measured by Quality of Life Enjoyment and Satisfaction Questionnaire - Short Form (Q-LES-Q SF) Total Score
secondary_outcome.description: Q-LES-Q total score is the sum of the 16 times of Q-LES-Q SF(range:16-80).Each item has a 5 point satisfaction level scale:from 1=very poor(worst value) to 5=very good(best).Larger values indicate a higher perceived quality of life enjoyment and satisfaction.Change in Q-LES-Q total score:total score at month 24 minus total score at randomization

secondary_outcome.measure: Change in Personal Evaluation of Transitions in Treatment (PETiT) Total Score
secondary_outcome.description: PETiT total score is the sum of the 30 items of PETiT questionnaire(range:0-60) on subjects perceived well-being, adherence, tolerability, satisfaction with treatment. Each item is rated by participant with a 3 point frequency scale:2=often, 1=sometimes, 0=never.Change in PETiT total score: total score at month 24 minus total score at randomization

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of Relapses of Schizophrenia or Schizoaffective Disorder
secondary_outcome.description: Relapse is defined as a hospital stay for psychiatric symptoms or a 2-point increase from baseline in the CGI severity score. CGI-S score ranges from 0-7 with 0 = Not Assessed, 1 = Normal, not at all and 7 = Among the most extremely ill subjects.

secondary_outcome.measure: Change in Simpson-Angus Scale (SAS) Total Score
secondary_outcome.description: SAS total score is the sum of the 10 individual-item scores (range:0-40), with the score for each item ranging from 0 to 4, higher scores indicate greater severity of Parkinsonian symptoms. Change : total score at month 24 minus total score at randomization. Increase in Change of total score indicates an increase in extrapyramidal motor symptoms.

secondary_outcome.measure: Change in Barnes Akathisia Rating Scale (BARS) Global Score
secondary_outcome.description: BARS global score is the 4th individual-item score on the BARS scale, the Global Assessment of Akathisia, with the score ranging from 0 (no evidence of akathisia) to 5 (severe akathisia). Change : score at month 24 minus score at randomization. Increase in Change of BARS global score indicates an increase in akathisia.

secondary_outcome.measure: Change in Abnormal Involuntary Movement Scale (AIMS) Total Score
secondary_outcome.description: AIMS total score is the sum of the 10 individual-item scores(range:0-40), with the score for each item ranging from 0 to 4. Change : total score at month 24 minus total score at randomization. Increase in Change of total score indicates an increase in abnormal voluntary movements. The lower score means lower intensity of abnormal voluntary Movements. 0 is best, 4 is worst. Increase in Change of total score indicates an increase in abnormal voluntary Movements.

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of Participants With Potential Extrapyramidal Symptoms (EPS)
secondary_outcome.time_frame: From start of the study treatment to last dose plus 30 days
secondary_outcome.description: Number of participants with adverse events potentially associated with EPS collected by MedDRA Preferred Terms as akathisia, bradykinesia, drooling, dyskinesia, dystonia, extrapyramidal disorder, grimacing, muscle rigidity, parkinsonism, restlessness, tardive dyskinesia, tremor

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Men and women age 18 to 65
- Both Eyes present with lenses intact (no previous cataract extractions)
- Stable place of residency
Exclusion Criteria:
- History of corneal surgery
- Legal blindness (defined as best corrected visual acuity of 20/200 or worse in one or both eyes
- Previous participation in this study

overall_official.last_name: AstraZeneca Seroquel Medical Science Director, MD

participant_flow.recruitment_details: A 24-month, multi-center, evaluator masked (ophthalmologist), open-label, flexible-dose, parallel-group study, 82 sites recruited Sept 2003 through Oct 2008. In total 1099 participants were randomized by Interactive Voice Response System (IVRS). One excluded participant was randomized before the rand visit, and never returned to any study visits.
participant_flow.pre_assignment_details: Screening for eligibility and must be cross-tapered off of all previous antipsychotic medications

measure.title: Gender
measure.description: Participants in the United States (USA) randomized by the study's Interactive Voice Response System (IVRS).

outcome.title: Presence of a Cortical (C) Type of Cataractogenic Potential Events in Participants as Assessed and Agreed by 2 Independent, Treatment-masked Ophthalmologists Using the Lens Opacities Classification System II (LOCS II ) Grading Scale
outcome.description: Presence of C type of cataractogenic potential event in participant was defined if any LOCS II grades of 2, 3, 4, 5 (with any grade of 0, trace,1 at randomization) assessed and agreed by 2 independent, treatment-masked ophthalmologists at any post-randomization assessment in one or both eyes. 0= no cataract; 5 is worst. There are no subscales. 0 is the best, 5 is the worst.
outcome.population: The 2-year eye per protocol (E2PP) analysis included all randomized participants who met eye eligibility, had a valid baseline LOCS II evaluation, had reached the study endpoint of either a LOCS II identified cataractogenic potential event or dosed for 21 months without a LOCS II event, and had no major protocol deviations.

measure.title: Presence of a Cortical (C) Type of Cataractogenic Potential Events in Participants as Assessed and Agreed by 2 Independent, Treatment-masked Ophthalmologists Using the Lens Opacities Classification System II (LOCS II ) Grading Scale

There are no subscales. 0 is the best, 5 is the worst.
measure.population: The 2-year eye per protocol (E2PP) analysis included all randomized participants who met eye eligibility, had a valid baseline LOCS II evaluation, had reached the study endpoint of either a LOCS II identified cataractogenic potential event or dosed for 21 months without a LOCS II event, and had no major protocol deviations.

outcome.description: Presence of N type of cataractogenic potential event in Participants was defined if any LOCS II grades of 2, 3, 4 (with grade at rand equals 0,1), or if the LOCS II grades of 3,or 4 (with grade at randomization=2) assessed and agreed by 2 independent, treatment-masked ophthalmologists at any post-randomization assessment in one or both eyes. 0 is the best, 4 is the worst.
outcome.population: The 2-year eye per protocol (E2PP) analysis included all randomized participants who met eye eligibility, had a valid baseline LOCS II evaluation, had reached the study endpoint of either a LOCS II identified cataractogenic potential event or dosed for 21 months without a LOCS II event, and had no major protocol deviations.

measure.description: Presence of P type of cataractogenic potential event in participant was defined if any LOCS II grades of 1, 2, 3 , 4 (with grade=0 at randomization) assessed and agreed by 2 independent, treatment-masked ophthalmologists at any post-randomization assessment in one or both eyes. 0 is the best, 4 is the worst.

outcome.title: Change in the Positive and Negative Syndrome Scale (PANSS) Total Score
outcome.description: PANSS total score equals sum of the 30-items scores (range: 30-210). Each item has ( 1-7 units), 1 indicates "absent" psychosis symptom, and 7 - "extreme" symptom degree. Change in PANSS total score : total score at month 24 minus total score at randomization.Alleviation of psychotic symptoms are indicated by a negative change in PANSS total score.
outcome.population: The intention-to-treat for psychiatric assessments (ITTP) analysis included all randomized participants who had a valid baseline and at least 1 post baseline assessment of PANSS total score, and received at least 1 dose of study medication.

measure.description: PANSS psychopathology subscale score equals sum of the 16-items scores(range:16-112). Each item has ( 1-7 units),1= "absent" psychosis symptom, 7= "extreme" symptom degree.Change in PANSS psychopathology subscale:score at month 24 minus score at randomization. measure.population: The intention-to-treat for psychiatric assessments (ITTP) analysis included all randomized participants who had a valid baseline and at least 1 post baseline assessment of PANSS total score, and received at least 1 dose of study medication.

outcome.title: Change in the Clinical Global Impression - Severity of Illness (CGI-S) Score
outcome.description: CGI-S score is accessed on a seven-graded scale ranging from most extremely ill/ very much worse (7) to normal/very much improved (1) , 1 is best. Change : score at month 24 minus score at randomization.
outcome.population: The intention-to-treat for psychiatric assessments (ITTP) analysis included all randomized participants who had a valid baseline and at least 1 post baseline assessment of PANSS total score (not related to CGI-S), and received at least 1 dose of study medication.

measure.title: Change in the Clinical Global Impression - Severity of Illness (CGI-S) Score
measure.description: CGI-S score is accessed on a seven-graded scale ranging from most extremely ill/ very much worse (7) to normal/very much improved (1) , 1 is best. Change : score at month 24 minus score at randomization.
measure.population: The intention-to-treat for psychiatric assessments (ITTP) analysis included all randomized participants who had a valid baseline and at least 1 post baseline assessment of PANSS total score (not related to CGI-S), and received at least 1 dose of study medication.

outcome.title: Change in Health-related Quality of Life as Measured by Quality of Life Enjoyment and Satisfaction Questionnaire - Short Form (Q-LES-Q SF) Total Score
outcome.description: Q-LES-Q total score is the sum of the 16 times of Q-LES-Q SF(range:16-80).Each item has a 5 point satisfaction level scale:from 1=very poor(worst value) to 5=very good(best).Larger values indicate a higher perceived quality of life enjoyment and satisfaction.Change in Q-LES-Q total score:total score at month 24 minus total score at randomization
outcome.population: The intention-to-treat for psychiatric assessments (ITTP) analysis included all randomized participants who had a valid baseline and at least 1 post baseline assessment of PANSS total score, and received at least 1 dose of study medication.

measure.title: Change in Health-related Quality of Life as Measured by Quality of Life Enjoyment and Satisfaction Questionnaire - Short Form (Q-LES-Q SF) Total Score

measure.population: The intention-to-treat for psychiatric assessments (ITTP) analysis included all randomized participants who had a valid baseline and at least 1 post baseline assessment of PANSS total score, and received at least 1 dose of study medication.

outcome.title: Change in Personal Evaluation of Transitions in Treatment (PETiT) Total Score
outcome.description: PETiT total score is the sum of the 30 items of PETiT questionnaire(range:0-60) on subjects perceived well-being, adherence, tolerability, satisfaction with treatment. Each item is rated by participant with a 3 point frequency scale:2=often, 1=sometimes, 0=never.Change in PETiT total score: total score at month 24 minus total score at randomization
outcome.population: The intention-to-treat for psychiatric assessments (ITTP) analysis included all randomized participants who had a valid baseline and at least 1 post baseline assessment of PANSS total score, and received at least 1 dose of study medication.

measure.title: Change in Personal Evaluation of Transitions in Treatment (PETiT) Total Score
measure.description: PETiT total score is the sum of the 30 items of PETiT questionnaire(range:0-60) on subjects perceived well-being, adherence, tolerability, satisfaction with treatment. Each item is rated by participant with a 3 point frequency scale:2=often, 1=sometimes, 0=never.Change in PETiT total score: total score at month 24 minus total score at randomization
measure.population: The intention-to-treat for psychiatric assessments (ITTP) analysis included all randomized participants who had a valid baseline and at least 1 post baseline assessment of PANSS total score, and received at least 1 dose of study medication.

outcome.title: Number of Relapses of Schizophrenia or Schizoaffective Disorder
outcome.description: Relapse is defined as a hospital stay for psychiatric symptoms or a 2-point increase from baseline in the CGI severity score. CGI-S score ranges from 0-7 with 0 = Not Assessed, 1 = Normal, not at all and 7 = Among the most extremely ill subjects.
outcome.population: The intention-to-treat for psychiatric assessments (ITTP) analysis included all randomized participants who had a valid baseline and at least 1 post baseline assessment of PANSS total score, and received at least 1 dose of study medication.

measure.title: Number of Relapses of Schizophrenia or Schizoaffective Disorder
measure.description: Relapse is defined as a hospital stay for psychiatric symptoms or a 2-point increase from baseline in the CGI severity score. CGI-S score ranges from 0-7 with 0 = Not Assessed, 1 = Normal, not at all and 7 = Among the most extremely ill subjects.
measure.population: The intention-to-treat for psychiatric assessments (ITTP) analysis included all randomized participants who had a valid baseline and at least 1 post baseline assessment of PANSS total score, and received at least 1 dose of study medication.

outcome.title: Change in Simpson-Angus Scale (SAS) Total Score
outcome.description: SAS total score is the sum of the 10 individual-item scores (range:0-40), with the score for each item ranging from 0 to 4, higher scores indicate greater severity of Parkinsonian symptoms. Change : total score at month 24 minus total score at randomization. Increase in Change of total score indicates an increase in extrapyramidal motor symptoms.
outcome.population: The Safety analysis set included all randomized participants who received at least 1 dose of study medication

measure.title: Change in Simpson-Angus Scale (SAS) Total Score

Change : total score at month 24 minus total score at randomization. Increase in Change of total score indicates an increase in extrapyramidal motor symptoms.
measure.population: The Safety analysis set included all randomized participants who received at least 1 dose of study medication

outcome.title: Change in Barnes Akathisia Rating Scale (BARS) Global Score
outcome.description: BARS global score is the 4th individual-item score on the BARS scale, the Global Assessment of Akathisia, with the score ranging from 0 (no evidence of akathisia) to 5 (severe akathisia). Change : score at month 24 minus score at randomization. Increase in Change of BARS global score indicates an increase in akathisia.
outcome.population: The Safety analysis set included all randomized participants who received at least 1 dose of study medication

measure.title: Change in Barnes Akathisia Rating Scale (BARS) Global Score

Change : score at month 24 minus score at randomization. Increase in Change of BARS global score indicates an increase in akathisia.

outcome.title: Change in Abnormal Involuntary Movement Scale (AIMS) Total Score
outcome.description: AIMS total score is the sum of the 10 individual-item scores(range:0-40), with the score for each item ranging from 0 to 4. Change : total score at month 24 minus total score at randomization. Increase in Change of total score indicates an increase in abnormal voluntary movements. The lower score means lower intensity of abnormal voluntary Movements. 0 is best, 4 is worst. Increase in Change of total score indicates an increase in abnormal voluntary Movements.
outcome.population: The Safety analysis set included all randomized participants who received at least 1 dose of study medication

measure.title: Change in Abnormal Involuntary Movement Scale (AIMS) Total Score

Change : total score at month 24 minus total score at randomization. Increase in Change of total score indicates an increase in abnormal voluntary movements. The lower score means lower intensity of abnormal voluntary Movements. 0 is best, 4 is worst. Increase in Change of total score indicates an increase in abnormal voluntary Movements.
measure.population: The Safety analysis set included all randomized participants who received at least 1 dose of study medication

outcome.title: Number of Participants With Potential Extrapyramidal Symptoms (EPS)
outcome.description: Number of participants with adverse events potentially associated with EPS collected by MedDRA Preferred Terms as akathisia, bradykinesia, drooling, dyskinesia, dystonia, extrapyramidal disorder, grimacing, muscle rigidity, parkinsonism, restlessness, tardive dyskinesia, tremor

measure.population: The Safety analysis set included all randomized participants who received at least 1 dose of study medication

category.title: Neoplasms benign, malignant and unspecified (incl cysts and polyps)

certain_agreements.pi_employee: Principal Investigators are NOT employed by the organization sponsoring the study.
certain_agreements.restrictive_agreement: The PI agrees to collaborate in good faith with AstraZeneca with regards to the contents and formation of any publication or disclosure to be made by the PI and to pay due consideration to the comments, views and opinions offered by AstraZeneca
